After closing the top-level undo group, this method invokes [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UndoManager/undoNestedGroup()].

This method also invokes [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UndoManager/endUndoGrouping()] if the nesting level is 1. Raises an `NSInternalInconsistencyException` if more than one undo group is open (that is, if the last group isn’t at the top level).

# undo()

**Instance Method**

Closes the top-level undo group if necessary, and then performs undo operations on the group.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func undo()
```

## Discussion

After closing the top-level undo group, this method invokes [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UndoManager/undoNestedGroup()].

This method also invokes [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UndoManager/endUndoGrouping()] if the nesting level is 1. Raises an `NSInternalInconsistencyException` if more than one undo group is open (that is, if the last group isn’t at the top level).

This method posts an [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSNotification/Name-swift.struct/NSUndoManagerCheckpoint].

## Related Documentation

- **groupingLevel**: The number of nested undo groups (or redo groups, if redo is the most recent operation) in the current event loop.
- **enableUndoRegistration()**: Enables the recording of undo operations.

## Performing undo and redo

- **undoNestedGroup()**: Performs the undo operations in the last undo group (whether top-level or nested), recording the operations on the redo stack as a single group.
- **redo()**: Performs the operations in the last group on the redo stack, if there are any, recording them on the undo stack as a single group.
